result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrell Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AS TO EACH COUNT:  Court costs and victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.  To be collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds. Balance to be paid by 11/7/2020.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
*Restitution set at zero.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for five (5) days.

superMiscConds.notes: Successfully complete:   a cogntive thinking behavioral modification program and a parenting program.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.  No alcohol or controlled substances.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (31 pages) commencing NOVEMBER 7, 2014 received and filed. kl

Defendant Darrell Williams in court with attorney Jeffrey Murrell.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. Additional statements by: Nicole W.
AS TO COUNT 7:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEAR, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 5 days.
AS TO COUNT 8:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEAR, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 0 days.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by11/7/2020; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 11/7/2020; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Successfully complete a Parenting Program
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab
Presentence Report received and filed. sab
Justice Point Violation Report received and filed. No action taken. sab
Sentencing hearing scheduled for 11-07-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Darrell Williams in court with attorney Jeffrey Lee Murrell.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Count 7 and Count 8:
Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to both counts and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as to both counts as charged in the Information/Complaint and enters a judgment of conviction.
COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  Bail remains as previously set.  Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 15.

Court orders a presentence investigation.  Order received and filed.

Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement received and filed.

Defendant Darrell Williams in court with attorney Jeffrey Lee Murrell.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Attorney needs more time to review discovery with the defendant.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Darrell Williams in court with attorney Jeffrey Lee Murrell.  Megan Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Parties acknowledge receipt of a copy of the doctor's report.  Parties do not challenge the report.  Based on the report, Court finds the defendant competent to proceed.    Case passed to be called with the codefendants.
Justice Report received and filed./ds
Report by Brooke Lundbohm, Psy.D., dated 7-7-14 received and filed./ds

Defendant Darrell Williams in court with attorney Jeffrey L Murrell.  Megan M Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense has received discovery and needs time to review with the defendant.  Attorney Murrell states he has two discs from the State, but cannot view them on his computer.  State has offered to have Attorney Murrell view it at the district attorney's office.  Attorney Murrell questions defendant's competency and asks for an examination.  Court grants motion and orders defendant to be examined by the forensic unit.  Order received and filed.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds
Transcript HEARING  commencing MAY 13, 2014  received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 14CF1682  (42 Pages).

Defendant Darrell Williams in court with attorney Jeffrey L Murrell.  Megan M Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Upon oral motion by the State, Court amends the criminal complaint to reflect the correction of case# "08CF5943" on page 8.  Sworn for the state:Vincent Lopez-MPD Officer.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia and no alcohol.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Darrell Williams in court with attorney Caitlin H Firer.  Defendant Darrell Williams in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
